alert.note: Alert for Oldham; Trimble (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 9:29PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Harrison, Jefferson, Clark, northeastern Crawford, northwestern Floyd, Scott, southeastern Orange, Washington, north central Oldham and Trimble Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 929 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Salem, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Salem around 940 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Scottsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky.
